author: {'steamid': '76561198004162646', 'num_games_owned': 1146, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 7391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4420, 'last_played': 1561706243}
review:
Princess Maker 2 Refine can make a lot of princesses but not much of a game.

[h1]Story[/h1]
The story of PM2R is near non-existent, but on purpose.  You are a wandering swordsman who saves a kingdom from a demonic siege by defeating the demon lord.  Ever thankful for your rescue, the king gives you a home, a butler, and a yearly stipend.  The heavens bestow a child of their own upon you.  Already age ten, you are tasked with raising her for the next eight years of her life.  The story is wildly open-ended from here, as there are dozens upon dozens of endings, but none are particularly impressive; amounting to nothing more than a few short blurbs about the kind of person your adopted daughter became when she left your home.  The sheer number of possible endings and permutations of those endings are far more impressive than the quality of them.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
PM2 is mostly a sim with some minor RPG elements.  Most of the player's time is spent in menus while clicking away at options.  And there are quite a few options to be had.  The little princess in question has everything monitored from her skills in cooking, art, magic, and combat defense; to her relationships with certain people, her weight or height, and her level of delinquency.  Some stats are hidden while others can be summoned in two different stats screens, but the hiddens ones making using them a pain.  The game itself is spread out across eight years and is moved forward one month at a time.  Each month is divided into three blocks and it's these blocks that the player uses to schedule their daughter's month.  Each block can be spent on one of four options.  She can go to work at various jobs that each make different levels of pay while also adding or subtracting to certain stats.  She can study a number of topics in classes that each cost quite a bit per day while raising her skills but possibly lowering some stats.  She can also go adventuring in one of four regions.  This kicks the game into a top-down adventure game with a small area to roam about.  Treasures can be found, important people can be met, and monsters will attack from all sides.  The battle system is nothing special.  In fact it's the opposite.  With only attack, magic attack, and item (of which only two seem to exist) options available in battle, the game is less a question of how you play and just more a question of how long did you send your daughter to kung-fu class.  The final way to spend a month's block is to rest which can be used to reduce her stress from working  as well as tweak some stats in certain ways.  The beginning day of each month can also be spent visiting shops to purchase or sell items or to talk to people at the palace in order to make societal connections.  Each September, a festival is held that has a small number of events for the young lady to compete in.  Winning these can be great sources of cash and notoriety.  While exploring the game's options at first seems like they might be interesting, the game quickly becomes a drag to play on consecutive playthroughs.  A first run may last a few hours as you read and learn, but by the third or fourth; players are likely to shut off the text scroll entirely in favor of mashing out a year as quickly as possible to stave off the boredom.  Earning one ending feels no different from earning another and without a proper narrative to at least keep the player interested for the ride; PM2 doesn't have much of a game to offer.

[h1]Presentation[/h1]
Drawn in the classic 80's era style of anime, PM2 at least looks somewhat nice.  Each ending has its own piece of art and there are a great number of characters, places, and event images.  All events in motion feature cute little pixelized versions of the characters that fit well with the old school art design.  Music ranges from vaguely listenable to ear piercing at the wrong volumes but the idea of remixing the main track to depend on the season is a neat touch.  The English translation is far from great.  Most of it is fine but it has a habit of failing a grammar or spelling test.  The game also seems to have some bugged endings that fail to check even with the proper stats and some events can occasionally check despite not having happened.  This can be game breaking for those after certain endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367142648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1083, 'last_played': 1561781791}
review:
我堂堂勇者居然只有500一年的收入！！！！！！连一个月的跳舞也上不起太可悲了。
当年作为一个少年居然玩的最多的就是PM2 PM3，太不可思议了！
其实这个游戏真的有很多教育要孩子的经验，谢谢游戏厂商让我提前体验了其中的艰辛和感动。无论结局怎样只要自己的孩子健康，快乐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198143597747', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1534772535}
review:
下好这个游戏却久久不敢点开，几次鼠标放在图标上却没有那个勇气
因为我怕打扰了记忆深处，那个尚且年轻的人的忧郁夏日
我印象最大的一次玩到匪夷所思的400还是800魅力爆表属性记不住了，唯一有印象的就是每次进城都小心翼翼地怕白菜让猪拱了
女儿无故离家出走，就只能丢了魂一样等女儿回家，思考自己到底哪里错了，是不是平时管的太严了？看着女儿生病错过丰收祭我却只能无动于衷
在那个没有空调的夏日，下巨大的古董电脑，dos界面弹出的华丽的开始游戏令人始终记忆犹新。
就因为那个记录，这个电脑我保留了很多年，直到离家多年后家人偷着处理掉了，让我十分惋惜。

点开游戏还是熟悉的界面，画面似乎为了高分辨率重画过了，比原版本好很多，还有新的配音。
事程也有新的画面和细节。
+真正的重画重置而不是随便做个优化骗钱
+全新配音
+添加了新的细节
+情怀满分
+似乎是理所当然的官中
成功的重置
-删除了神秘商店等经典元素
PM2不是我接触的第一个也不是最后一作，但后几部都简略了战斗等系统，支线和隐藏剧情自然也没那么完整，在某些点的彩蛋也是很有意思，还有战败后被土匪大姐姐指导快乐这类事件不知道本作有没有阉割（笑），总体而言2代说是系列中前无古人后无来者的最经典一作不过分，pm系列也是2代的大成功才广为人知的。

现在打开游戏始终不舍得给女儿安排任何行程，所以只是对着女儿发呆，希望女儿永远留在一开始的那一天。
本来想看看神秘商店还在不在但始终没有尝试。超喜欢那倾国的衣服。
听说本作重置第一时间拿下，但很久不敢打开，
因为女儿还是那个女儿，自己早已经不是那个在那个炎热夏日，早早关灯躲在被窝里，对着荧幕上女儿留言掩面痛哭的自己了。
总觉得没有勇气面见阔别已久的女儿。（笑）
写着写着眼泪就流出来了，真是不争气。
如果有谁找到了神秘商店什么的原版彩蛋请给我留言谢谢

review: 2应该是几部作品中最好玩的了，虽是20年多前的游戏，看着对于现代技术来说过于老旧的画面却依旧能玩的津津有味。相比之下，1作为雏形还是有不少欠缺的地方，虽喜欢入坑作4的画风和详细的事件故事情节，但和3一样的缺点是删除了武者修行这么好玩的元素不得不稍微减分，5虽综合了前几作的优点但通篇时间太过于长，打出两个结局后就没有动力继续玩下去了，不知道能否期待出Princess Maker6.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056303091', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1699232796}
review:
Princess Maker 2 Refine is a game I bought on a whim, and it was a great purchase! The game puts you in the position of raising a young girl into an adult, mixing a money management simulator with a raising simulator with some RPG elements thrown in. Will you raise your daughter into a warrior or will you focus on making her into a proper lady?
The artwork of the game is gorgeous and reminds me of anime from the 90's. The animations are also very charming. Combat isn't very deep, but with the right stat increases your daughter will be demons and dragons in no time. The voices are in Japanese and are well voiced. The gameplay lasts until your daughter turns 18, which goes by surprisingly fast.
Overall I'd recommend Princess Maker 2 Refine if you enjoy simulator games with optional combat. Also Cube is best boy no contest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060467709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1504973718}
review:
美少女夢工廠2

這是要20年前左右的遊戲
經典，老玩家建議收藏系列作。

新生代玩家也可以嚐試，但我較推薦給沒"涉世太深"的玩家，以及12～16歲玩家。
這是款養成遊戲。
畢竟現代流行元素和當初差很多，畫面畫質上也是，新玩家或許不會懂當時有這個遊戲玩的感動。


目前steam版有多少bug，要有心裡準備，但不影響遊玩。


推薦可以等折價時期買系列作組合包

author: {'steamid': '76561198353198197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1590542046}
review:
este juego es realmente adictivo, muestra una originalidad que no se ve en muchos otros juegos, lo unico que me a impedido disfrutar el titulo al 100% es el idioma, pero este problema no tiene comparación con los puntos positivos de este titulo de la saga princess maker, que presenta mecanicas realmente adictivas y complejas, un sistema de aventura presioso y multiples finales ue hacen que cada partida se sienta independiente de las anteriores, realmente una joya de este genero de juegos, que, lamentablemente no posee la fama que merece, y para mi desgracia, vuelvo a recalcar, no posee una traduccion al idioma español y no hay planes de crear una traducción a algun otro idioma debido a la antiguedad, poca fama y gran cantidad de texto que posee el juego. 
juego 10/10
una inovación increible

author: {'steamid': '76561198058122387', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1508422787}

review: 내가 돈을 못 버는 탓 우리 딸이 고생하는건 일하는게 귀찮아서 딸의 돈으로 딸에게 용돈을 줬던건 재능도 없는 새끼들이 우승을 하는게 너무 배알이 꼴리고 억울해서 확실히 압살하고자 학원 미장원 요리점 도장에 딸을 보내고 있어 난 기대치를 1배도 안올려 어차피 우리 딸이 우승이니까 그래야 딴놈들이 우스워 보이니까 그래야 내딸이 더 재능있어 보이니까 아니 얼마나 더 재능충이여야 합니까 딴애들의 노력은 노력이 아닌 겁니까 부모님의 기대를 등에 업고 나와 떨어져버린 아이들은 불효자 되는겁니까 모르겠네 딴놈들이 재능 없는 탓 몰라 내가 이 game을 play 해버린 탓 몰라 내가 한심하고 돈이 없는 탓 몰라 내가 여러 일들을 시킨 탓 프메 딸 종특 무술,요리,미술 아님 춤을 좀만 가르쳐도 우승 하는 탓 그런 애를 키우기 싫어 괜히 일만 시켰다가 재미 없어 15살 쯤에 꺼버린 탓 네가 좆밥이라 칭한 내딸은 널 찌꺼기라 생각해 어디를 봐도 이길 길이 안보이지 그래 그년은 999 였는데 아빠는 되려 날 울렸어 그래 내 탓이지 그래 우승은 개뿔 재능 없는 것도 내 탓이니 딴거 배우고서 웃자 그전까지는 척에서 그치니 절망스럽잖어 내 상황이 싹다 그저 저년이 4곳 다 쳐먹어서 그런진 몰라도 볼수록 줫같이 느껴져서 저년이 날 가둬둔 상황이 위안이 돼 아직도 이길 수가 없어서 모르겠네 딴놈들이 재능 없는 탓 몰라 내가 이 game을 play 해버린 탓 몰라 내가 한심하고 돈이 없는 탓  몰라 내가 여러 일들을 시킨 탓

review:
かつて娘を育てた「お父さん」たちへ

author: {'steamid': '76561197984891862', 'num_games_owned': 1221, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1931, 'last_played': 1704514852}
review:
Here is my video review of Princess Maker 2 Refine if you prefer to see gameplay.
https://youtu.be/7XCHSV-NrYI?t=1m51s

In summary, while the gameplay is a little dated (it's based on a 25 year old DOS game), for the limitations it had to work with, this is an excellent game. It's a child raising sim, giving your divinely adopted daughter a series of jobs, classes and adventures and seeing how your actions carried with her into adulthood. Though the title might make you think your goal is to raise a Princess, the truth is you are free to do what you want. Have her go to church a lot and she become a nun, send her to art school a lot and she'll become a famous painter. Or become the Princess of Freaking Darkness.

For example, due to some questionable parenting decisions, my daughter ended up becoming a dominatrix upon reaching of 18, but because I did such a good job making sure she lived a fairly stress free life, she fell in love with me and we got married.

At $20, it's exceptionally pricey for what is effectively a 25 year old game, but if it is your kind of game, it's worth it. Soundtrack is also exceptional considering it comes with 4 different versions of the game's OST (DOS, FM TOWNS, PC98 and Refine).

author: {'steamid': '76561198149646650', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1593830249}

review: Really great game. Lots of replayability. Many ending, it's interesting what outcomes I get from what classes and jobs I place my daughter in. Translation is pretty alright and i'm glad I was able to buy this game. Highly recommended if you want something light to keep you busy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198437806073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1649121307}
review: I love this game so much! It is so unique. I used to love the dos version. It is great to get to play a legitimate English release.  This is probably the most in depth game out of the first three(4 and 5 are not released yet). PM3 is good but has translation and achievment issues and PM1 tends to drag on just for one playthrough. This one is the strongest in my opinion.  Along with stat managment there is also rpg elements(not super in depth though). I have spent more time on this than most games. The sheer amount of endings give you so much to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091091372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2956, 'last_played': 1634154977}
review:
어린 시절 하루종일 지칠때까지 했던 추억의 게임. 추천을 안할 수가 없는 게임.
해보신적 있으신 분이라면 고민할 것 없이 구입하시길 바라고, 해본 적 없으신 분들에게도 보장된 재미가 있다고 감히 자신하고 싶네요.
사실 그 시절의 도트 그래픽이 아닌 포토샵으로 대충 뭉갠듯한 리뉴얼 그래픽이라 구입을 매우 망설였었습니다만 막상 플레이 해보니 업적 달성하는 재미도 쏠쏠했고 게임 자체는 변한게 거의 없기 때문에 플레이에 문제는 없었습니다. 단지 일본어 더빙 퀄리티는 약간 미묘한 감이 있었습니다.
하지만... 여전히 어린 시절 했던 아름다운 도트 그래픽이 없는 점은 아쉬울 수 밖에 없네요.. 저작권 문제라도 있는 것일까요, 도트 그래픽 버젼을 따로 판매한다 해도 구입할 의향이 있는데...

author: {'steamid': '76561197979018612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1599904978}
review:
Un jeu qui parait intéressant sur le papier...Mais qui devient franchement ennuyeux lorsqu'on se rend compte qu'il n'a aucun sens.

Après 3 parties, j'ai obtenu, malgré des choix très différents, 3 fois la même fin. Je me suis donc résigné à faire ce que je déteste  : lire le wiki en ligne.
Et j'ai compris d'où vient le problème : les stats n'ont aucun fichu lien avec la fin désiré !

Par exemple, j'avais boosté l'intelligence au maximum pour la faire devenir scientifique. Or, avoir une intelligence au-dessus de 500 est inutile pour cela ? Alors pourquoi fixer une limite à 999 ?
Et surtout, pourquoi faut il avoir 400 de foi et 338 de réputation de combattant ? C'est bien connu Einstein, Tesla et Edison étaient de grands boxeurs...

Bref, je déconseille fortement ce jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155230267', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 2436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1586481542}
review:
Este juego es peor que la heroína.

Ya había jugado a este título tiempo atras en una versión pirata y realmente ahora que lo vuelvo a jugar me doy cuenta de que este es el juego más adicitvo que eh provado en mi vida, no es una obra de arte, ni un juego perfecto, pero esa necesidad o esa inquietud de saber en quien se combierte tu hija es algo que poco a poco consumirá tu alma.

El juego principal que va de organizar el horario de tu hija e intentar que poco a poco vaya ganando reputación en la sociedad, ya sea ganando concursos o hablando con gente importante. Pero vamos con lo raro, hay pildoras para agrandar los senos de tu hija y de hecho te dan un logro si estos llegan a cierto tamaño, también hay una especie de modo de juego del estilo de los primeros Final Fantasy en el cual puedes matar a un señor de la guerra, o que incluso te puedes casar con tu hija, adémas de ponerle ropas sugestivas, sí, creo que destaca que es japonés. Lo que no se nota es que es del mismo estudio que creo Neon Genesis Evangelion (yo tampoco se porque hicieron un videojuego de hacer princesas).

Creo que dejando aparte los puntos malos que se van ganando con el paso del tiempo, destaca mucho una cosa que pasa en este tipo de cosas y son los complejos sistemas de atributos, el juego te muestra una parte de estos pero solo es la más simple, cosas como la fecha de nacimiento o el tipo de sangre también dictan los atributos que tendra tu hija, y siento que el juego depende mucho de que lo jueges varias veces para que llegues a comprenderlo mejor.

La verdad es que Princess Maker 2 es el mejor de la trilogía y es un valor con un altísimo valor rejugable (lo que ahora importa mucho) y lejos de los fallos que destaque es un buen juego que si te gustan los simuladores, los rpg y los juegos con muchísimas posibilidades, lo más probable es que este juego te guste.

review:
대체적으로 추억의 갓겜
그러나 조금 아쉬운 점은 다음과 같다

1. 시리즈 특성상 엔딩을 보기위한 노가다가 필요하다

author: {'steamid': '76561197998240233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1567902936}
review:
20 years after my first save this game makes a comeback to steal more time from me.

Pros: Multiple endings, nice music, good graphics (for 1993), awesome gameplay.
Cons: Windowed mode cannot be resized, some endings are missing and there's a few translation issues, also some censorship but minor issues overall.

5/5, 100/100, excellent for it's time, it's gameplay never gets old.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136236639', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1584246062}
review:
>be me
>be 30
>war veteran
>fought in the war and saved the kingdom or sumtn
>living a good life in the city
>suddenly one day, 2nd of february 
>the god handed me a daughter
>wot.jpg
>ask me to be her father
>okay whatever lol
>realise that she's suddenly already 10
>wot2.jpg
>started raising her the way im in life
>she's working in the farm and practicing to fight
>sent her to classes too so she doesnt grow as stupid as i am
>doing this until shes 11
>realise i dont want her to be a savage stupid man like i am
>focused her studies on being a fine woman and being an artist
>she got a job as a hairdresser
>all is well

review: 经过探索，不用秘籍也能达成有钱和‘第一年就得奖的办法。注意，选择女儿为11月1日出生的AB型天蝎座，女儿的感知会非常高，魔力也高，厨艺有10+，初始感知有39，魔力有22，每个月还会额外加2点感知，父亲也为天蝎座，这样培养女儿到收获祭就有整整一年的时间。然后一开始选择健壮饮食，+体力，然后选择农场打工，每个月要发零花钱降低疲劳，注意体力一定要高于感知，疲劳不能高，高了就去选择山间度假降疲劳加感知，这样大概到6月份的时候，体力200+，感知接近200，此时去商店买多个加感知降疲劳的娃娃，把感知加200以上，然后出发去东部森林，去石头那里睡觉，由于感知超过200，就会遇到加厨艺的妖精，睡3次，厨艺就可以到90以上，加上感知200+，已经足够获取烹饪大赛冠军。接下来一切就容易多了。注意，去森林遇到怪物尽量躲藏，被发现了就逃跑，实在逃不过才用魔法打，不要用攻击，只用魔法，魔法用完了就睡觉。

Otherwise, don't bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318709688', 'num_games_owned': 21, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1533636623}
review:
玩美梦系列真的是有20多年了，刚开始认字就入手了美梦2，简直惊为天人，每天放学回家第一件事就是开电脑打美梦2。
趁steam打折买了这个童年回忆（绮丽版）。听到有BGM我简直要哭了，好似玩过的只有用win3.2系统玩的美梦2才有BGM，然后听到语音我都震惊了，居然还有语音2333
绮丽版唯一的不好就是没有神秘商店（其实我想说国王的新装你们都懂），毕竟15岁女儿的果·体真是太棒了！讲真绮丽版没有原版人物好看，可能我是一个人2333


给玩得少又不习惯没有神秘商店的玩家一个建议吧。第一年一边武者修行（没错为了箱子里的钱）一边打工一边学艺术吧。如果你女儿选择的是10月的生日，第一年就能画出那个天使的画，分数在97分以上那副画在收获祭上就能吃8年，再加上送的画笔可以卖1050，非常妥了。
后面就自己发挥咯，个人喜欢学武艺去南部修行，打骷髅或者地狱鸟都是赚钱的好路子，一个月走3次南部修行至少可以撸到4000+的金钱。

不说了我继续去玩了

author: {'steamid': '76561198085045108', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1488548090}

author: {'steamid': '76561198283082076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1509800923}
review:
养成内容特别丰富，还包含了rpg探险，即使是拿到现在，也是精品，丝毫不简陋。为了补完童年回忆而购入，利用同一个存档，顺利打出了魔王，女将军，sm女王三个结局，并且打出了特殊结婚对象魔王路西法，非常满意～以下是几个要点:
1.去沙漠探险，在信仰值＞15左右时，夜宿在魔王别墅门口，会出现魔王酒宴事件，可以用信仰交换大量其他属性，刷气质魅力特别容易。注意信仰如果不够换的话，女儿会直接喝掉魔王给的酒，罪孽狂加……
2.魔王结局需要武术评价和魔法评价都＞400，罪孽＞500，其他数值可以参考女国王结局，不同的是道德，信仰，烹饪评价完全没有高要求。需要在魔王别墅发生过事件。个人觉得这个结局比较震撼，值得一试。
3.sm女王只要求武术评价和魅力高，不用刷魔法评价。
4.引用网上攻略:嫁给魔王路西法达成条件：魅力≥300，气质≥200，罪孽≥道德×2（或罪孽=道德=0），曾触发过事件“魔王的酒宴”
据说要喝下过酒才行，因为自己玩的时候喝了一次，所以确定不了是否为必要条件。
虽然本代的魔王是一位秃头强壮大叔，但是他拥有数不尽的金银财宝呀！理解女儿的选择……
5.经典的龙嫁，在沙漠入口的龙之遗迹打败小龙，15岁后没事就去找老龙拿零花钱，魅力＞200时龙会送紧身衣，去个那么几次就行了，16岁时老龙会带着小龙主动上门提亲，答应就好。ps 小龙收保护费时，如果女儿选择不交钱且不进去了，会有特殊台词，推荐听一听，非常可爱
6.万年管家吉普，在魔王结局里被路西法称作“魔界的贵公子”，瞬间出戏……

author: {'steamid': '76561198108214334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1678025777}
review:
I remember playing this a lot a long time ago. When it was finally officially released, I had to have it.

In this game, you raise a daughter sent by the gods. What you raise her to become can be anything from a humble housewife to the god of war. She can marry, or not, a variety of suitors. Her future is always in your hands. It is a bit grindy, but it's always fun to see what you can guide her to become

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198101818454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3115, 'last_played': 1636936882}
review:
Pour sûr, c'est un jeu rétro avec des graphisme limités. Mais grâce à ça, ce jeu est jouable sur mon ordi pourri.

Princess Maker 2 Refine est fun et accrochant. On veut toujours faire un mois de plus. Voir notre fille grandir et se dévlopper vers un certain destin est vraiment valorisant... ou carrément surprenant! De la femme au foyer parfaite au général de l'armée, en passant par devenir un escorte de bar douteux à aventurière, tout les futurs sont possibles. C'est ce qui rends le jeu si intéressant.

À ce jour, j'ai fais 4 parties pour 4 fins différentes. Il y en a encore des tonnes à découvrir. Quel destin votre fille aura?
Notez que ce jeu est non-censuré.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042504560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1816, 'last_played': 1601087971}

author: {'steamid': '76561198117964885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1510371479}
review:
TL;DR: The game's okay, but there is regular sexualization/objectification of your child throughout the game, which you can do almost nothing about.

Ok look: I've done several playthroughs and a few aborted ones. At first this game was interesting and it was kinda cute. It wears off after a time. I tried to come back after a few weeks, same thing. The game gets to be dull and pretty tedious, but this isn't my main problem with the game. I wouldn't have bothered to come and review it just for that. 

My real gripe is how throughout the game, everyone was sexualizing/objectifying my daughter. Even MORE once she turns 15. You can't get access to the best clothes unless she's around 90lbs (even as a full grown 18-year old). Some of the dresses have her almost nude (google siren's robes). Others are thinly veiled dom/otherwise sexy outfits. She's a child. In the desert area, there's a dragon who will constantly comment on my daughter's chest and gives her money scaled to how busty and sexy she is. Father-daughter conversations with her often touch on her asking you about her "proportions" - even when she's 11 years old. At 15, if she has high charisma (which is high-key code for sexual attractiveness), grown-ass married fathers will proposition your daughter to be their mistresses. She's a child. She's a damn child. It wears on you after awhile.
If you enjoy the game and want to play it, that's fine. But for those of you who would rather not have everyone talking perverted crap regularly about your daughter in terms of her body, this is your heads up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974558663', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1629637067}
review:
Gods give you a little girl and you can do whatever you want with her for like 8 years. That's pretty much Princess Maker 2 in a single sentence.

Every month, you have to choose 3 things that your daughter will spend her time on. You can make your daughter work at a job, which will boost her stats and make her stressful in exchange for money. Each job boosts different stats and requires different stats to do well in. With your child labour-earned money, you can send your daughter to school, where she can learn to fight, to not be an asshole, to cook or that the Earth isn't flat. The lessons cost money and if you run out, you just wasted day(s) of time doing nothing. Some paths of education will earn you a rival or result in being challenged while you're out shopping for a winter coat. You can also go adventure in 4 different locations. Adventuring is like your typical old-school RPG: You walk around, randomly encounter people or monsters and you get to choose if you want to talk/fight/ignore/hide. You'll also find chests with items, and there are various NPCs and hidden events in the wild. You can get perved on by an old dragon if you're old enough. You can challenge the War God to a fight. You can find and arrest a wanted criminal. Or you can just run into angry mermaids that have boobs and nipples and will always fight you.  Lastly, you can reduce your stress levels by giving your daughter free time or going on a vacation. Going on a vacation will cost more money, be more effective, show you a nice vacation photo and sometimes change a stat like weight.

Yes, the game has SO FREAKING MANY STATS. There's your physical stats like height, weight, bust/waist/hips, but also things like 3 different reputations (Housework, Fighting, Magic), various combat-related stats and things like Sin. The stats (and some in-game events) are what determines the ending that you get, and there's a whole spectrum of them. You can end up as a regular housewife. Or maybe you kill the Demon King and take over Hell. The "best" ending for the game is, BIG SURPRISE TO LIKE 3 PEOPLE, is becoming the Ruling Queen. The stats can also trigger certain events or prevent certain events from happening, such as a high stress level leading to sickness, truancy or running away from home for a month.

Princess Maker 2 doesn't have much in the way of "gameplay" outside of the adventuring part. Studying and working are done with a montague-like video that shows how your stats change, with a window describing whether you did well or just sat on your ass all day. And while it is possible to play the game without looking at the stats, it's going to be very difficult if you don't understand why your daughter keeps running away or why the butler insists she eats a lot every month. So if that's not the kind of game you fancy, Princess Maker 2 is shit. But if you're willing to experience it, Princess Maker 2 has a lot of funny, awkward, cute, happy and cool moments.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055556831', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1708632021}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004701958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1521764106}
review:
There's a reason why a game from 1994 recieved updated graphics and a full voice over. Can you think of any other games from the 90s or early 2000s that do that? If you can, it's because they were insanely good games, well-loved and of high quality. That's what this game is, high quality --- it's visual novel-esque with heavy simulation aspects. This game has so much replayability that you can enjoy it over and over again, playing it through again right after you finish the first time.
You manage your child's life from around age 10 until adulthood, and shape the adult she becomes. I highly recommend this if you like sims of any kind, and you enjoy management style games. Even if you don't like visual novels, this is old school and a bit how original Japanese style VNs used to be back on the SNES, more like a game and less like a book. So give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040056831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1503714454}
review:
[h1]たぶん知っておいたほうがいいこと[/h1]

①アルバイトの成功条件として能力値が設定されている

たとえば料理屋は「料理」の能力が要求されるため、長期間働いて料理技能が十分に伸びるまで、失敗しつづける仕様になっている。
こういうのは問題ないのだが、たとえば髪結いの仕事だと、必要な「芸術」の能力は髪結いをしても成長しないので、いくら働いても金がもらえない奴隷労働と化す。
アルバイトにかぎらず、キーとなる能力値を知らないとどうしようもない場面がたくさんあるので、無理せず攻略情報を見ながら遊ぶのがいいと思う。それでも十分面白い。

②「自由行動」を月末に入れる

ストレスによるお邪魔イベントは月末に発生するので、月末にストレスを下げるようにスケジュールを組む。またストレスに対応するパラメータとして体力・信仰・モラルがあって、これらを上げた方がスムーズに遊べる。

③キャラメイクはまじめにやった方がいい

誕生日（守護星）によって初期パラメータが大幅に変わる。血液型はもっと重要で、A型だとストレスが毎月プラス2されるため、娘が笑わなくなる（これ本当にひどい）。


[h1]ここがつらい[/h1]

テキストの表示速度は変更できるがスキップ機能はないため、クリックを連打するはめになりダルい。吟味しないで遊んでもエンディングまで3時間はかかる。
あと表示速度をノーウェイトにするとアルバイトや習い事の結果が見れなくなるのが不便。エンディングまでカットされるから気をつけよう。
イベント数も豊富とはいえないので、8年という長期間で育成に作業感が出てくるのは正直否定できない。プレイヤーの妄想力が試される。
でもテキストじたいは淡白だから、おかずになりにくいんだよな。

[h1]ここがいい[/h1]

UIをふくめ、全体として完全な調和のとれた、美しいグラフィック。しかもボリュームがある。
娘のグラフィックが豊富なのは当然としても、モブキャラとか、背景とか、ちびキャラのアニメーションとか、細部にいたるまで実にリッチな作り。バブってるころの日本メーカーの凄みを感じられる。
あと赤井孝美のデザインは本当にきれいだと思う。コンピューターゲームに征服される以前の、古い和製西洋ファンタジーの格調の高さを体現している。
こういうファンタジーって現在のオタクカルチャーではほぼ絶滅した領域だし、輸出も少ないと思うので、海外レビュアーにえらい高評価なのはすごく納得がいく。
まるで一冊の絵本のような、あるいは宝石箱のような。うつくしいゲームだと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561198049035827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3154, 'last_played': 1684756844}
review:
Second most recent playthrough: I thought it would be funny partway through to make her a nun and have her marry the demon butler so I aimed for that ending. Result: She became a general and married a cheerful, sociable knight. And also she hated me for making her train all the time. 

Most recent playthrough: Burnt by my last experience, I decided to focus on making sure she won the Art Contest at the Harvest Festival for the cash. 14 year, probably due to all the dance lessons I'd been sending her on for stamina and glamour her rival was the Dance Party girl, to my displeasure as I had a sure winner with the Advent of Angels painting. But I went along with it because I didn't want my daughter to hate me. I made sure she smoozed with the Minister, I beggared myself buying her a dress, I sent her dance class after dance class. She ran away during the month of the next Harvest Festival. She had to fund her dance classes with hairdressing that year. Result: Became a dancer and married the demon butler which I wasn't even trying for. And she loved me for cherishing her. 

We make plans for our children and push them in that direction, but children will make their own choices and follow their own paths, parents plans for them be damned. That's why this game is an awesomely realisitic parenting simulator, apparent from all the fairy tea parties and demon feasts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982971433', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1483162329}
review:
Apesar das poucas horas que aparecerá registrado aqui no Steam, eu já perdi DEZENAS de horas jogando Princess Maker 2 na época em que surgiu a primeira edição traduzida em inglês, uma década atrás. Aproveitar o relançamento desta vez foi um mais para alimentar a melancolia, mas incrivelmente, mesmo depois de décadas, o jogo ainda estava tão fresco na minha memória que havia pouca coisa adicional que valesse a pena ser explorada de novo. 

Para quem já jogou a primeira e antiga versão, não há muita razão para adquirir o jogo, porque o conteúdo é o mesmo, arrisco dizer inclusive que com mais erros de tradução do que o original, e com alguns conteúdos "censurados" para agradar a sensibilidade exacerbada dos tempos atuais.

Para quem não conhece o jogo, contudo, é um prazo cheio dentro daquela categoria bem de nicho denominada de "life sim". Essencialmente você "interpreta" o pai de uma garotinha (fada na verdade) que lhe é presenteada pelos deuses com o objetivo (como o próprio nome diz)  de se transformar em uma princesa.

Para fazer isso o jogador precisa equilibrar a agenda de atividades da sua "filha" em períodos de lazer, estudo, e trabalho (na era medieval as restrições ao trabalho infantil não eram muito acentuadas). Cada atividade que é desenvolvida dentro da agenda aumenta (ou diminui) as estatísticas da personagem, sendo que essas estatísticas são essenciais para tudo, desde a chance de sucesso em determinadas atividades, até a quantidade de dinheiro ganho nos trabalhos desenvolvidos e, acima de tudo, para integrar uma equação final que dará o resultado do jogo: indicar o que aconteceu com sua filha depois que ela fez 18 anos. Claro qeu o objetivo é que ela se torne uma princesa, mas uma das graças do jogo é precisamente "encontrar" os diversos finais que as diversas combinações de estatíticas permitem, conferindo ao jogo um grau de "replayability" muito alto. 

Vale muito a pena dar uma chance, apesar da idade do jogo.

I asked for and received a refund almost immediately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130402546', 'num_games_owned': 628, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 6357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1744, 'last_played': 1529133401}
review:
I'm one of those people who have played PM2 when I was a still a kid and loved it. I always found it a shame that PM2 never was able to be released in the west officially so I was ecstatic to find out that a company (this being CFK) was going to localise all the Princess Maker Series with PM2 being the first to be released. Of course I am going to support it.
Playing it again (this time with the refined version in English) here's what I can say about this game:

Pros:

+First of all this game is addictive. It's easy to lose yourself in plotting your daughter's schedule and trying to guide her to whatever ending you're gunning for.
+This game has a high replay-ability value. PM2 has a lot of endings, A lot of events that a triggered based on what skills your daughter has, You wont be able to finish this game in a couple of playtroughs.
+Has endearing characters such Cube for example.
+Has an adventuring mode that gives the game more game-play and appeals to anyone who likes JRPG.
+Good Voice acting

Cons:
- The English release has awkward translations. Although CFK has made updates to improve them so this is not a major con but something to take note.
-Game has Risqué endings and events. This can be avoided in the game though if you are uncomfortable with them.

Overall, I would recommend this to anyone who love Sim games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084739635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1499842460}
review:
I played the original version way back when, so how could I not play the official Steam release?

The good:
-Wide variety of endings & secrets. You'll be playing a while if you want to see everything!
-Nice artwork that's been updated a bit without losing its charm.
-Speed-up options. Particularly handy for speeding up the Harvest Festival(which is very long and repetitive).
-Voice acting! It's all in Japanese, but it's a nice touch for a re-release.

The bad:
-The translation is very hit or miss. Some things are phrased awkwardly, some characters get their names romanized differently in different places, and some things seem to be flat-out incorrect(the text after a win in the fighting tournament makes it sound like you lost, for instance).
-The work/training dialogue gets very repetitive after a while. It'd be nice to be able to disable it.

The neutral:
-No tutorial. I don't mind, and it's really not surprising since this is a game from the pre-handholding era, but be warned that the game expects you to figure everything out yourself. (Or read an outside guide)
-The bulk of the game is an endless statgrind/money management sim. I've played games like that before and enjoyed them, but it could come as a surprise to someone expecting a more traditional VN or RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122945124', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1628772436}
review:
一周目完毕，女儿成为了将军！
看着她一年年长大越来越成熟美丽，最后离开我的时候真是感慨万千。

我也算是PM系列的脑残粉了，主要是4代和5代的！
（强烈希望Princess Maker4&5也能登陆steam！并且求中文版！）
2代是第一次认真地好好玩下去，吉普还是熟悉的声音太好了w和女儿的互动也很可爱。

虽然每代发行时间有差距，和后出的相比肯定有缺点，但还是想说一下美中不足的部分。
（也证明了PM系列每代的进步w）
感情线比较单薄，和结婚对象的互动都是草草带过，特别是小龙几乎没有感情基础，像玩家硬塞给女儿的感觉。
女儿太容易出走，前期没钱培养女儿上课，挣钱基本都靠修行…打怪开箱子，感觉有点强制。
不能快速地快进，跳过养成部分，非常不方便！

当然以上缺点…4代开始就改进了很多，不如说非常完美。
如果第一次接触这个系列的玩家喜欢这个游戏，真的强烈推荐PM4和PM5！

author: {'steamid': '76561198030900574', 'num_games_owned': 1023, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1498800294}
review:
Refunded, doesn't exactly fit what I hoped it had.

Focuses too much on finances than the actual faughter/daughter raising fantasy than I hoped.  Felt like I had to go look up a guide and metagame the money before I could actually start playing.  Maybe the other games do a bit better on this, but I know not how they look.

Really wanted to like it, but early on it just didn't work out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086982993', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1499113604}
review:
It's a pretty old game, and that definitely shows. I feel like if you want to play a game like this, you should just buy Long Live the Queen instead or even Cute Knight (which is also old, but good).

Cons:
Even in the Refine edition, controls are outdated and visably old.
No tutorial and buttons aren't clearly labeled as to what they are, so you have to stumble through.
It's a tad slow and monotonous. I understand that's common with these games, but usually it's broken up with events and regular dialogue to make it tolerable.

review: So far, I've gotten a resounding 26 hours out of this game, and I am still excited to play more. It was way more than I expected it to be! It's so cool to see every choice you make really affecting your daughter. Seriously, everything you do matters. If you're into those sort of games, give it a shot. Totally worth it if you're a completionist, or if you just want to explore the ways of raising your daughter. The only reason I'm having a hard time getting some endings is because I get too attatched and don't want to lead her astray. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197965489700', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1671884491}
review: Como autentico fan del juego original que fue Princess Maker 2, debo decir que esta versión vale cada centavo. No puedo creer que haya perdido tanto tiempo dudando sobre si comprarlo o no. Han mejorado absolutamente todo, tanto el diseño de los personajes, muy suaves, bien presentados. La música se oia muy clara, limpia, estuve jugando por un largo rato sin que me molestara (cosa que tampoco me pasaba en el juego original) pero la nostalgia...  uff!!! ♥, este juego le hace justicia a Princess Maker 2 y mejora la experiencia. Hay muchas cosas para experimentar, sigue teniendo más de 60 finales distintos, "todo puede suceder" y con mis lagrimas en el teclado les digo esto: no hay nada más gratificante que un personaje que criaste a tú manera te relate como fue sú experiencia contigo. Es demasiado bueno, altamente recomendable. Por ultimo, el juego tiene voces japonesas, las pueden silenciar, pero como me gusta el anime, me senti todavia mejor de poder escuchar hablar a mi hija y cuando ella crece sú voz tambien cambia. Seas fan o no de la saga de Princess Maker, es un juego que tanto chicas como chicos deben probar. Lo unico malo que encontre, fue que no podemos sacarle capturas de pantalla, use bandicam y paint para eso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284660597', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1528064632}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198034080989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1522800187}
review:
Do you like lolitas from space/heavens? Do you like stat sims? Do you like Light RPG stuff? Do you like Mideaval times? Do you like anime? Then Princess Maker 2 Refined is for you. A TL;DR is at the bottom of the review. :)

Refined being the word they went with for "We updated the original title and put in some stuff and took out some other stuff to make it run smoothly"

This game was originally released on DOS a while back (if memory serves correctly) and it was a fun little title with a built-in cheat system that let you basically get a bunch of money (among other things that are a bit controversial and NSFW by today's standards) called Mad Eddy's. 


Mad Eddy's Cheats and Goods has sadly been removed and I hope it gets translated and re-added in a future patch or I will be very sad because it's nearly impossible to get these achievements without consulting a web guide if you want a specific ending. 

Aside from missing one of the elements that made the game a little easier for newcoming players this game holds up well in my eyes and is a lot of fun for a good few hours with high replayability with its total of over 50 different endings (I think). Some of the downsides I don't like that will hopefully find a fix soon are minor bugs such as the ending letter just sort of getting skipped if you prefer to play with voice acting turned off. Yes, they added voice acting. It's pretty good in my opinion, though I prefer to play the game without voice acting turned on because I liked the original where there wasn't any and personally the voices in my head fit the characters just a touch better. 

If you're a fan of the series you'll love this game and what it tries to do. If you're new to the series, it's a good start, but will probably be pretty confusing at first. 

One last thing to note: Some of the artwork contains NSFW 18+ Content as I've seen from community screenshots of other players' subsequent playthroughs and results so if you don't like nudity or something like that then maybe wait for a patch that censors it or something.

Final Verdict (TL;DR) as of current state (6/16/17): 8/10
-Some of the missing elements make it more challenging than it was previously
-Some minor but fixable bugs keep it down
-Holds up extremely well
-Fun with lots of replayability 
-Really lovely artworks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055274497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1495792302}
review:
I bought this game because the Internet told me it was similar to Long Live the Queen. The Internet was wrong.

This game lacks any narrative of Long Live the Queen, or more like, any narrative whatsoever. Random events occur often without any visible reason, story or meaning. Some skills may lead to your daughter running away or getting hit on by suitors. Without reading an actual walkthrough, you have no clue which skills cause this, even as it is happening. Nothing in this game is intuitive or exciting to discover. There is no clear goal to whatever you are doing. You can't even find the joy in your daughter succeeding, because it is impossible to relate to her in any way. There are a dozen or so different lines your daughter will say when you talk to her, many of them generic Japanese schoolgirl type lines such as "I wish my chest was bigger".

Were you to catch this game for a couple of euros/dollars/rupees, I would recommend it. It will offer you a few hours of clicking around and seeing what happens. However, if what you are looking for is a narrative and story based, intuitive goal-centered game, I cannot recommend you buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358132841', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1581644501}
review:
Bizarre game. Of all people, my wife recommended this to me. Said she played it growing up. Ok...

Fed her 2 pills from the "Far East Trader" that apparently grew her boobs. In the end, her "bust" was comparable to Akeno of Highschool DxD (They keep track of this and yea, I wondered what anime tiddies were like hers. Crazy, right?) Apparently its important to know if you're two-time Combat Tourney champ has a big rack. PS I won all the Harvest Festival Comps. Why does that matter? idfk. Had her work at the "Illegal bar" and "Cabaret" once... for the lulz. She willingly chose to be a concubine twice, even though her allowance was equal to what that dude gave her and she was scolded both times. I mean, really? Plus lets not get into the fact she at times doesnt know what a SWIMSUIT is. Yeesh.

My ending: You best dad. Mars be like: We were gonna reclaim her, but bro, you aiight as a dad. We cool. She got married to some dude and became a writer. My girl is Emily Dickinson! Jane Austen! Gertrude Stein! #ProudParent #Myhighschoolerissmarterthanyourhonorstudent

Outside of the awkward Engrish aka "Mika has been defeated by Surly Katana" but wins the fight... and the cringey scene where she get nekkid for no reason... (I raised an exhibitionist?) I liked the game. Entertaining, pretty damn unusual, but entertaining. High replay value imo, if you care to try other routes and see what demon you can unleash on others.

***EDIT***  I reviewed this in 2017. Here I am in 2020 still playing it for various endings. Now I got a dual ending: Married Queen Olive. So I am king... hells yeah.
Other endings: Queen of the Damned, Princess Lucifon, Cabaret Dancer, Queen Olive w/ no Hubby... and more...

I have bought 1 and 5. Seen Peebs play 3 and have to say this is BEST of the games imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037003719', 'num_games_owned': 4057, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1493834411}
review:
哲學家尼采曾經寫過一段名言：『白晝之光，豈知夜色之深。』，這句話的意思是指人的認知有限，無法理解不同領域的知識，亦無法理解他人的人生價值觀，對於還在幼年時期的筆者，有幸從父親那取得《Princess Maker 2》這款遊戲，當時的我對養兒育女完全沒有概念，所以對此部作品沒有太大興趣，直到近二十年後的現在，透過某股神秘力量驅使之下，我終於玩完了這被情懷所包裝的往事回憶。本作的故事大綱是在敘述生活安樂的人們過於貪婪，不再尊敬與祭祀眾神，憤怒的眾神命令來自地獄的魔王入侵人界，打算給予無知的人類教訓，身為勇者的你碰巧來到兩軍交會之處，不知原因如何，你奮不顧身地加入戰鬥，最後擊退魔王，讓人類得以繼續存活，來自天界的星座守護神看見你的事蹟，決定交付年僅十歲的女孩讓你照顧，她的命運完全掌握在你的手上，遊戲便正式開始。

《Princess Maker 2》精華之處在於，系統給予玩家八年時間，我們可以利用這段時間培育女兒，提升諸如魅力、智力、感性、體力等各項數值，這些數值的高低會直接決定女兒的結局，八年時限一到，遊戲便會蒐集各項數值，統計出不同的結局。舉例來說，假設你將女兒培育成戰鬥技術高超的武者，那麼可能會令女兒變成皇家騎士、道場館主、或是繼承父親事業成為勇者，智力較高的女兒會成為魔法師或史學作家，魅力指數高的女兒則有機會受到貴族青睞，接受皇室成員邀約，直接成為下一任皇后或是公主，順帶一提，想要玩父嫁結局的紳士們不用擔心，完成指定條件就能讓你嫁娶辛苦培育長大的女兒，追根究柢確實兩人沒有血緣關係，痛快的生一打活潑健壯的兒女根本不是問題，完全合法的！


培育女兒的方法總共分為兩種，一種是打工兼差，另一種是教育學習，由於遊戲剛開始取得的資金有限，大多玩家應該都跟筆者一樣，會先讓女兒前宿屋或是育幼院工作，藉由持續工作累積家務經驗並賺取些許金錢後，便可專注於一門課程培訓，等到訓練成果有起色，就能決定要將女兒塑造成怎樣的一名女性。當然，玩家也能在送女兒工作或上課之餘，讓她去城外進行武者修行（若不想讓女兒走戰鬥路線，可忽略此玩法），城外存在著許多危險敵人，建議事先將女兒的戰鬥技術提升至五十左右，且於武器店購買基礎武防具，準備齊全之後再出發，才不會讓女兒沒一會就被野怪秒殺，浪費時間又讓女兒無辜受傷。

每年固定舉辦的收獲祭是驗收教育成果的重要慶典，收穫祭共分為舞蹈大會、烹飪大會、藝術大會、格鬥大會四種賽程，每場大會所要求的能力數值都不盡相同，決定舞蹈大會能否獲勝的關鍵在於魅力，烹飪大會則是要與其他高手比較廚藝，藝術大會要求非比尋常的藝術才能，格鬥大會依賴女兒的戰鬥技術或魔法實力。從收穫祭得到優勝，不僅能得到高額獎金，更可取得獨一無二的特殊獎品，除此之外，外界給予女兒的評價也會水漲船高，戰鬥評價和魔法評價的提升會讓女兒在該領域更加強大，社交評價的提升則會給予女兒認識政商名流，甚至是與騎士、國王、王妃、王子等貴族結識，開啟皇后或公主的結局路線。


較為可惜的是，身為父親的玩家，鮮少有機會跟女兒互動，所謂的日常生活都被安排好的行程表佔據，不努力讓女兒成為某一方面的專長的話，資金不會有所提升，好吃懶做的勇者更不會自己出門工作，總是靠著國王施捨的五百金幣過活也不是辦法。雖說玩家可以安排十日假期跟女兒出門遊玩，實際上也沒有什麼地方好去，最多就是前往深山或是海邊，減輕壓力的同時，依照遊玩地點的不同，女兒會獲得不同的數值增減，例如前往深山欣賞花草樹木會提升女兒的感性數值，夏日時前往海邊，會降低女兒的體重，且還能夠讓膚色曬成健康小麥色（體重跟膚色的不同都會直接顯示在立繪上，細節處理滿分）。

『學到很多東西的訣竅，就是一下子不要學很多。』想要樣樣精通的結果，通常都是樣樣不精通，過少的自由時間會給予女兒過多的精神壓力，女兒會開始變得叛逆，叛逆期的女兒會心不在焉，工作偷懶就算了，就連上課也不會有任何成果，玩家僅能透過安排休假或給予零用金來安撫女兒情緒，希望她趕快改過自新，回到從前的乖寶寶形象。但相對地，假設太寵女兒，女兒會開始肆無忌憚的亂花錢，甚至還會隨意離家出走，或是接受中年怪叔叔的搭訕，成為對方私下包養的小三（沒有開玩笑，筆者的女兒一口答應成為中年大叔小三），所以要如何在嚴厲與放縱中進行取捨，取決於各位父親的教育方針是否正確。


《Princess Maker 2》雖然是款距今二十幾年的老作品，但仍不失其樂趣，所謂不被時代洪流沖淡價值的作品正是在指這類作品，被稱為【經典之作】一定存在不易取代的特色，就筆者個人而言，這部作品之所以會在我心中成為經典，絕對不是它滿足了人們對背德父嫁的渴望，更不可能是滿足一輩子不可能結婚之人的慾望。簡而言之：『喜愛孤獨者，非神即獸。』，人類都是懼怕孤獨的生物，一旦離開人群，沒有任何人可以保持理智生活下去，作品中登場的女兒是在當時少數可以跟玩家互動且能直接決定命運的女性角色，養死寵物雞的經驗相信大家或多或少都有，如果你養死的是作中的女兒，心中獲得的罪惡感絕對會比寵物雞的死去還深重，這正是為何本作是經典的主因，它會影響到你我心境。


優點：
+完成單輪遊戲約兩小時，包含五十種以上結局，全數達成要花不少時間。
+重玩價值極高，不看攻略遊玩會開啟意想不到的路線，獲得更多的驚喜。
+玩法設計方面多彩，教育、打工、修行、收穫祭，樣樣精通需要下足功夫。


缺點：
- 此版本為和諧過的全年齡向，許多福利內容如國王的新衣都被從作中移除。


結論：美少女夢工廠系列已經多年沒有新作，希望此經典系列能持續發展。


網誌圖文好讀版：
http://mgrim214.blogspot.com/2017/05/princess-maker-2.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198027715984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1492741732}
review:
At age 10 I realize my funds cant even support her class for more than a week.
At age 11 I made her work to pay for her own classes.
At age 12 I made her go out into the wild for weeks on her own with sharp objects.
At age 13 I ran out of money for tuition and made her work more than before.
At age 14 shes too frequently stressed out and often ranaway from home.
At age 15 I made her participate in the painting competition but shes wants to dance instead. I refused because painting had better reward.
At age 16 I brought her an expensive robe from the salesmen with her own money.
At age 17 I rejected every potential suitor's marriage proposal and frequently go out on vacation with her.
At age 18 I somehow manage to make her into a writter.
Also, I married her.

10/10 I'm the worst father ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056641498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1955, 'last_played': 1651448188}
review:
2011 год, выпускной класс. Жизнь состоит из подготовки к выпускным, вступительным, сна, иногда еды, и ЕЁ. Скачанная с abandonware сайта игра, DOSBox - я играю украдкой в те часы, пока дома никого нет, чтобы добрые родственники не вздыхали, что "пора уже своих заводить, а она всё игрушки гоняет". Перевод игры неполный - в некоторых концовках просто нет текста, но никого это не пугает. Альтернативы всё равно нет.

2016 год, институт уже окончен. Princess Maker 2 в голове хранится, как тёплые воспоминания - и я уже приняла тот факт, что раз после 2007 года от Gainax про франшизу ни слуху ни духу, то они наверняка на неё забили. И в конце сентября муж интригующим голосом говорит, что у него для меня очень хорошая новость. Я захожу по ссылке на Steam. Слёзы, радость, чепчики в воздух.

Появление этой игры на западном рынке значит... очень многое. Серия Princess Maker выступила если не прародителем - были и более ранние примеры - то точно популяризатором жанра raising sim, и сейчас многие игры этого жанра стоят на том, что выстроила она. И точно также, как многие значимые игры, годы и годы она оставалась исключительно с закорючками - но хотя бы получила переводы на корейский с китайским, и приобрела своих фанатов и последователей не только в Японии. И именно это в конечном итоге и привело игру к релизу здесь - видимо, корейская компания CFK также решила "доколе?".

Не всё, конечно, прошло гладко. Но CFK сами признавали, что недоработки есть и приветствовали то, что им на них указывают, работая над своими ошибками. Я не знаю, в какой именно момент игра стала окончательно комфортно играбельной, но к концу февраля даже добавили ачивки. В сравнении с древним переводом под DOS версия от корейцев в чём-то даже точнее и лучше - и точно полнее.

Но в чём вообще суть? Если вы не в курсе, что такое raising sim, то Princess Maker 2 - это отличное место, чтобы познакомиться с жанром. Есть герой - обычный такой RPGшный герой. После определённых событий боги решают, что это отличная идея - дать суровому воину, который большую часть жизни резал мечом монстров, девочку на воспитание, не особенно спрашивая ни его, ни её. Проходит год и вот мы здесь - девочке десять лет, её надо кормить, одевать, воспитывать - готовить ко взрослой жизни и выводить в свет. Туториала нет - добро пожаловать в отцовство! 

Конечно, поможет демон-дворецкий, выделенный местным Сатаной в качестве компенсации за причинение инвалидности, но распоряжаться воспитанием придётся самому. Наращиваем/опускаем статы, любуемся на красивые анимешные иллюстрации и анимацию, бегаем по полю приключений, натыкаемся на ивенты, которых не просто много, а ОЧЕНЬ МНОГО. Игра невероятно богата на контент, а учитывая, что оригинальная дата её выхода - 1993 год, это заслуживает уважения.

Хотя, конечно, в Стиме появился не оригинал, а улучшенное переиздание 2004 года, но зачастую заставить работать даже игру такого типа под современные системы - это уже достижение.

Ещё плюсы:

+ Отсутствие цензуры! Не то что бы там было особенно что цензурить, но если вас, как и меня, раздражает аляписто накинутая "одежда", на которой разве что не открытым текстом написано "привет, я цензура!", то можно спокойно выдохнуть - здесь этого наконец-то нет. [spoiler]Главная претензия у меня всегда была к картинке летних каникул 12-13 лет, где Оливия спокойно себе загорает на пузе без одежды - SoftEgg накинули на неё криво нарисованное платье до колен, которое очень резко выделяется на фоне шикарной графики, и вообще в контексте "девочка загорает на пляже" смотрится просто... шта. Переплюнули их только корейцы, которые в нестимовской Refine версии обрядили её в вырвиглазное синее бикини со стрингами (!), которое даже ягодицы подчёркивало... зачем?[/spoiler]
+ Наконец-то можно пропустить вступительные титры! Для этого понадобилось всего лишь 23 года.
+ Больше не надо ломать глаза с мозгами об английскую систему мер - оригинальная метрическая красуется и в английской версии! [spoiler]Минус в том, что наконец-то осознаёшь, насколько нездоровые требования нужны для сохранения параметра "худая".[/spoiler]

tl;dr - покупайте. Извините за стены текста, но я люблю эту игру. И я счастлива видеть её здесь - видеть как действительно продукт и переиздание, а не попытку влёгкую срубить деньжат на ностальгии.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243300976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1564886431}
review:
This stat-building game is highly addictive and has dozens of endings. I'm 1.5 hours into the game and my daughter is 13 and a strong lumberjack. Every time I send her out to work, I fear she won't come home. You start to really become attached to your daughter and feel like her actual father. Every choice you make will determine her future. The only complaints I have are that the UI is a little confusing and I wish the dialogue wasn't so repetitive, though that is more of the fault of the original game than this remake.

EDIT: At 16, my daughter won the cooking contest against Marthia and at 17 won the dance contest. On her 18th birthday, she became a farmer's wife. :/ I guess I will try again. Anyway, it took me about 4.5 hours to finish the first playthrough.

蛤蛤蛤蛤

二十多年前的游戏复刻版来了

你问我资磁不资磁

我当然资磁拉


-----------------------

二十多年前，青葱少年，欣赏着一知半解的剧情，听着单声道的音乐，看着屏幕前和自己差不多大的女孩子，懵懂的快乐。


为那份单纯的美好


老板！买单！

author: {'steamid': '76561198039322156', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1541318106}
review: I absolutely looove raising sims and this is the iconic start to them all. A fantastic game! Ive done about 3 playthroughs so far and it's definitely challenging depending on what you're aiming for. The game so far has worked perfectly and the translations have minor flaws at best, which don't create any confusion, imo. I'm really praying they add it's sequels after this one. If you loved Long Live The Queen, Then you will Adore this. Keep in mind ofc though, that this one is much less linear story-wise than LLTQ(Infact, has very little story to none if at all.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198024472669', 'num_games_owned': 1202, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1625365320}
review:
My Daughter, Trollop Hoss, was a disgrace to our family name. I can barely type this I am so disappointed.

Immediately upon seeing my totally-going-to-be-a-hoss of a daughter I realized that it was going to be a tough life for her. I planned on sending her to hard labor every day of her life from ages 10-18 and then see where things go from there. LIKELY a life as a sturdy brick shithouse nun if the gods would smile upon me. Optimistically, I did as I set out to do. I worked her every day for 3 months on a farm with no rest or leisure and at the age of 10 years 3 months she became a GANG MEMBER and would only wear a nightgown. 

At that point she didn't want to do anything anymore, just kept like, literally squatting and pissing at the farm or something like that, until she was arrested by soldiers that found her hanging out with theives. They locked her up but for some reason they let her go, so I sent hossica back to the farm. I noticed she was gaining a lot of strength but still was beefy so I cut her diet down to the strictest level possible. This broad could still bale hay, let me tell you. They actually increased her pay.

One day shortly after all of this she ran off and came back with a HAND GRENADE. Literally. So I figured now would be a good time to enter her in the harvest festival combat arena. He first opponent was literally a blind guy who punched her so hard in the face it bloodied her up and she quit. I was pretty pissed off that she was so pathetic so I sent her back to the farm, but they kicked her out for having a bad attitude. 

I was going to have her repent at church but realized she would be better off wandering around in the woods so I sent her on a mission to the eastern woods. The first person she came across was a nice woman so obviously my daughter attacked her with the grenade. The woman somehow didn't die after getting hit with the grenade and instead punched my daughter in the face causing Trollop to run away. This was twice now that she had run away from fights after getting punched in the face. 

It soon became winter and she was sick and cold because she only had a summer dress. FINE. I spent almost all our savings to buy her some mail armor to go over the dress to keep her warm. But she still got sick. At this point I was basically out of empathy for her due this persistent weakness and because of multiple arrests for hanging out with ragamuffins and the most unruly people. We also had little money since her lazy weak ass decided to not work when I sent her off. She was just super lazy and I kind of don't even like thinking about it because it's super disappointing. Only after going to jail would she work.  And she ended up being upgraded from hay work to LUMBERJACK. No flannel shirt but she didn't need it, she was soon hossin out at about 600 STR, dumb and clumsy as hell but could cut wood like a chainsaw. Good for her. Finally some progress. Maybe next year I will buy her that teacup for her birthday.

But after 3 birthdays in which I didn't buy her anything, 9 arrests, 3 harvest festival ass-kickings, about 8 forest beatdowns at the hands of city guards that she attacked of her own volition, and about 950 days of slacking off she finally got sick and died at the age of 13 from working at a farm and chopping down trees. And one time I sent her hunter and she didn't shoot anything. Then some angel came and told me I was a super bad dad for never taking her to the hospital, but nothing happened to me beyond that so, whatever angel, total waste of a trip since I'm sure my daughter is burning in hell for living such a lackadaisical life.

review:
가격이 약간 비싼감이있지만, 추억값으로 지불하기엔 전혀 아깝지않다.
프린세스메이커2라는것 자체만으로도 살가치가 충분함.

프린세스메이커 시리즈 중 프메3가 최고 명작이라고 생각하는 사람중 하나로..
얼른 프메3가 스팀에 나왔으면 좋겠당..

author: {'steamid': '76561198026462234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1637, 'last_played': 1499477874}
review:
I cannot even count the number of hours I spent playing this game way back in the 90's.  It is beyond incredible to get to play it again through Steam.  The translation is pretty darn good in this version, and it is the same amazing game to which I lost much of my youth.  To this day, I don't think I managed to get even half of the endings.  There are SO many.  I really am looking forward to getting some more this time around.

I cannot possibly recommend it enough to people who enjoy life sim and raising sim games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079184183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1487484620}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198010947375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1487523808}
review: I used to play this game on DOS as a kid to pass the time. It's just as fun as I remember it and the translation is a lot better than the one that was slapped together for Princess Maker Refine 1. It's a simple game that's hard to master but once you figure out the numbers behind everything, it's easy enough to work toward a goal with just enough of a feeling of chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146279804', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1682977314}
review:
It's a great game if you're one of those people who like to min max everything (which I am).

I recommend playing it blind a few times first to perserve your virgin experiences, but you will need a guide to get all the best and worst endings. 

Also protip:
Farming is your best friend for the first couple of years.

review: 从DOS时代玩起，特别喜欢探险模式里的各种战斗和奇遇，但是以前所有版本（没地方买正版全是下载的盗版）安装之后方向操作都有严重问题非常不方便，但是这次的支持Windows10的Steam版本非常给力！！拿到手后终于第一次无操控问题地通关了一遍！希望以后：1、打开神秘商店DLC；2、Steam支持IOS系统安装、游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198294339164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1681262387}
review:
One of the first games that I played when I was young and I still come back to play it from time to time.
I didn't get this on steam until recently, but I've played quite often when I was using Win 95/98... (ended up playing all PM1 through PM 5 and Go-Go Princess, which is saying something).

It can be frustrating at times when you can't get that ending because you need to micromanage status, but it's all worth it when you do reach your goal!

If you enjoy games like Long Live the Queen, I'm sure you will love this one although I'm more partial to PM2 <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198046264962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1711920967}
review:
I remember getting my hands on the almost complete English Beta version of the original second Princess Maker 2 and spending DAYS raising various daughters. It was AMAZING and seeing this finally get an official English relase was and is a dream come true. Granted, the Softegg translation flowed better but the recent patches provided by the devs have already polished this release superbly.

This game led to games like God Save The Queen being developed, it's a classic. Does it have its issues? Sure, some of the possible content can be slightly squicky. The translation still needs polish, especially the endings. 

But apparently this release also will make English releases of PM3-PM5 possible. And that would just be awesome. Definitely recommended, a great classic!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071767479', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1488071405}
review:
I played both the original and refine versions of this game, and I can firmly say that the refine version lives up to my expectations perfectly. I do have some problems with this release, however.

First of all, the achievement system is bugged to a small degree. Achievements do pop up where they should, but are not implemented correctly, making a few of them incredibly easy to get. It's not a huge bother and makes it easier to earn all of them. Second, the font used for text is very off-putting and does not match up well with everything else in the game. they should've used the original font from the old beta, as it would've matched up much better and made the game easier to read.

My biggest problem with this release is the translation, which I assume was done by amateur translators. There are many misspellings and grammatical errors, which makes the job seem unprofessional. They also changed a lot of the names of the stats, which will confuse veteran players of the series if they don't have the names memorized. There are also some cases where things are translated completely wrong, which can confuse both new and veteran players. Overall, the translation is just shoddy and they should've hired a better translator.

Does this mean I don't like it? Of course not. The core mechanics of the game are still perfectly intact and the art of the characters and locations has been flawlessly remastered to fit modern day expectations of the gaming industry. It is not a perfect game, but that doesn't mean it is a bad game. I believe if the developers work on the translaton and achievement mechanics more, this can become a crown jewel of a game.

Overall, I do reccommend new and old players of the series pick this game up, it is definitely worth your money. I give it a final rating of 9/10. I would give it a perfect score had the translation and achievement system not been butchered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064938096', 'num_games_owned': 638, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1484778959}
review:
My daughter has no manners, gets sick fairly often and runs away every second month. I am a shit parent thats for sure.

Jokes aside, I didnt think that this game would be this challenging. I had a different game playing with the same idea and even though it was challenging, it was not nearly as challenging as this one. Having not only to deal with the growth of your daughter but also with her own needs in terms of clothing and a good study to broaden her horizon. 9 days at school and nearly all of our money is gone, spending 9 days working and only recieving half pay because of mistakes. Her getting sick and then running away on the next day.

This is a good game considering how old it is. I enjoy what I played so far and I shall make sure that she will turn 18 at some point!

author: {'steamid': '76561198143272052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1511753367}
review:
I never cried, then I bought this game. Its a nice change of pace from the constant war and death in video games. Dont get me wrong thats all fun too, but its nice to get something peaceful and happy. In the game you are a great hero who saves a nation from certain doom, and as a reward heaven grants you a 10 year old girl from heaven to raise as a daughter. Its a strange reward to be sure but ok. You choose her birthday, her name, your name, your birthday and your age and the game begins. She has a ton of different stats, which get higher or lower depending on what you have her do. having her work at a farm will increase strength and stamina but will lower elegance. Doing housework helps her learn cooking and cleaning but she makes no money. There are other jobs such as lumber jack, babysitter, prostitute. That last one is real, and it pays a ton of money, but no daughter of mine will be caught in a place like that so off she went to the lumber mill. She was as graceful as a giraffe on roller blades but she could break you in half if she wanted to, and she was only 13 at the time. Outside of work she can study, which you spend money on rather than earn it. This affects more active stats like combat skill, decore, manners, intelligence and so on. You need to balance studies wil work and also which ones you select depending on what you want her to be. For instance its a good idea for her to practice Kung-FU and be a lumber jack because they complament each other, while dancing classes and lumberjack cancel out and leave you with a ton ofwasted money and nothing to show for it. When I first palyed I wanted to go with a princess Zelda type, very smart, good sword fighter, magical, and a princess. the problem was all those lessons cost more that you will have most of the time so I ended up sticking her in a resturant where she made bank and taught her manners so she would be noticed by the royalty. I also wanted her to be intelligent so I also gave her science classes. She ended up becoming aa housewife, and a damn good one at that. AAlthough she didnt marry a prince, she did marry a rich man, so I was satisfied know my son in law would eaty well the rest of his natural life as he married the official best cook in the nation 6 years in a row. 

My second runthrough I wanted my daughter to take my place as legendary hero, so I got her to work the farm and do Kung-fu. Long story short, she defeated the God of War when she was 15 and eventually became grand general of the royal army. She married well and I shed actual tears. 

Good game 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198106999194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1557061288}
review:
Ah Parenthood, what could be more precious a gift than your own tender offspring to raise, cherish and nurture into helpful members of society...

This game however shows just how awful a parent you can truly be without needing to be brought before social services like the effing monster you are! 

After seeing screenshots of this game for about ten years or so my curiosity had been piqued, after all if I could raise a stable of proud racing Chocobos and adorable little Chaos then an actual Dad Simulator RPG wih a human larva should have been a fun new challenge and, after PeanutButterGamer's review made me aware of this games Steamification (it's a legitimate phrase as of now!), I decided to shell out on the reduced price tag and purchase me Princess Maker 2.

The story is simple, the Kingdom of Bleh has pis*ed off the gods so they send the demon king to generally bugger things up but then enter our hero! (you, ya fool) After being badly injured you acquire a demon butler, a miniscule pension and a hearty handshake from the King. one day you are drawn inexplicably to a mountain and promptly have an Astrosprog foisted upon you by a god. Like any sensible person suddenly endowed with a ten-year old cosmic starchild that came out of a ball of light you comply and have eight years to properly raise your new daughter.

The gameplay is pretty simple, you get three blocks of time in a schedule for your daughters time. Each month you must raise money (through conveniently lax medieval child labour laws), send her off to be tutored and level up her stats, and ensure she is healthy and happy. You may also, if you wish, send her off adventuring to loot ancient temples and fight monsters for pocket change and sometimes a nice bit of treasure which also boosts her stats. Prior to deciding upon her schedule you may talk to her, buy things for her for those all-important stat boosts and introduce her to them high-society nobs living in the palace, just make sure you upgrade her manners stat before letting her go near certain people.

So, how did my first playthrough pan out? Awfully, I ended up bakrupt twice and failed. However once I learned of the Kung-Fu Farmer technique I soon had a teenage badass war-wench raking in the money and kills in a way that wouldn't be out of place in Slayers. So the day of her 18th birhtday came and it was time for daddy's little starsprog to go out into the world and forge her own path in life! Then I found out she utterly sucked at doing paperwork so they refused to let he rinto the army, she established a dojo but had no social skills so she ended up failing as an instructor, she did get married though and I didn't pi*s the gods off by her becoming a delinquent dominatrix (yes... that can happen... don't ask why just try and avoid it...) so, in general, I pretty much didn't screw up entirely.

To summarise my experience with Princess Maker 2 short of it being about royals shagging it's exactly what you'd expect from the title short of it being called "Dad Simulator RPG", if you like the training/tuition/raising aspect of games like Monster Rancher and Digimon World or just have to check it out due to sheer curiosity and a quick laugh I'd wholeheartedly reccomend it. It's a very, very odd duck but i'd say it's worth checking out if you like RPGs or management sims and want something unique. and if Uncle Gabe has put it on sale even better!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992442433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1484196886}
review:
条件：气质800，道德500（非必须，但是没有达成的话最后还是由王子当国王），战斗评价440，魔法评价430，社交420，家事420
结婚：王子结婚：每年1月见青年武官
龙族结婚：西方沙漠击败之，魅力300时见老龙，几月后求婚，答应
父亲结婚：本结局不能
管家结婚：不能
以上条件不满足就是无名氏婚姻
女王工作与学习过的地方：家政，农场，酒店，教会；剑术，格斗，礼仪，绘画，神学，魔法
参考数值：
体力400
腕力300
智力300
气质900（最重要）
魅力500
道德400（达到500不易）
信仰800
罪孽0
感受500
疲劳0
战斗评价或魔法评价过高时，拒绝挑战，一次减15，以此平衡
社交=礼仪100+艺术100+谈话100=300；舞蹈冠军加40，3届，40X3=120，条件达成420（不含奖励值）
家事=烹饪100+扫除100+待人100=300；烹饪冠军加40，3届，40X3=120，条件达成420（不含奖励值）
攻略流程：
设定：生日10月1日，血型O（各方素质加高）或者A(后期涨道德)
第1年，10月至2月尽量多安排家政，每个月给零花钱降疲劳以多安排两次家政。2月结束的时候保证烹饪上60，不够就S/L. 烹饪60以后只要疲劳不要太高餐厅打工就可以完美完成了，在餐厅打工保证钱的前提下，尽量多安排去山上度假增加感受。9月份上山度假增加感受最高，所以尽量安排9月三次山上度假。到收获季烹饪肯定满了，感受只要在120以上就机会获得总冠军（但优势不大，需要S/L多试几次）。胜利后不吃蛋涨100感受，保证今后两年的烹饪总冠军。钱超过1000,5000时,商人来访，三次都买恶魔首饰。
第2年和第3年，练剑术直到攻击满，然后练格斗直到战技满。没钱就去农场打工。收获季依然是烹饪，选择吃蛋涨体力。
第4年，先去北方武者修行，拿东方片刃剑。再依次去东方，南方和北方把三个通缉犯抓了（记得把宝箱也搜刮了）。去墓地打一次工打赢亡灵骑士（不一定会出记得S/L）。这样就攒了一大笔钞票了。狂学魔法直到满（但是千万不要去学加智力），然后去西方武者修行把三个恶魔项链都给恶魔，气质和魅力暴涨300点。在恶魔洞口扎营睡一晚选择涨气质。这一代的地狱鸟和骷髅兵打死以后都掉很多钱，没钱就来这刷，运气好能挣四五千。彻底摆脱穷鬼时代。收获季参加武斗大赛。
第5年，酒店打工直到谈话满。然后恶补自然科学直到智力300。然后练舞蹈。收获季参加武斗大赛并且要以魔法取胜。
第6年，学一次绘画然后狂上舞蹈直到艺术满。由于魅力高，艺术满以后随便买件最便宜的丝衣就可以舞蹈冠军了。然后上礼仪开始冲最难的气质。每个月顺便去王宫聊聊天涨人际关系。收获季舞蹈比赛。
第7年，差不多一整年都去学礼仪了直到气质800.收获季继续舞蹈大赛。
第8年，气质800以后全力去教堂打工尽可能多的增加道德。如果战斗评价和魔法评价不够或太高，就反复上街直到有人挑战。打赢可以加评价，拒绝就降评价（现在的水平要打输也不可能）。

author: {'steamid': '76561198322980520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1588253371}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062722704', 'num_games_owned': 5064, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1547476351}
review:
用了13个小时，尝试了好几次之后终于全成就了，纪念天国的娱乐通代理的123合集绚丽版，当年也花了我38大元了。
这游戏非常良心，有简中，不是机翻，而且发行商说之后其他PM系列游戏也会陆续上steam。

成就最难解的应该是嫁给魔王，在N次失败后，查阅了不少资料，终于搞定了，需要这么几个条件：
1、魅力>300，气质>200，罪孽>道德的两倍；
2、触发过魔王的酒宴事件（信仰<20时露营在魔王家门口）；
3、触发过魔王给属性事件（信仰≥20时露营在魔王家门口）。

很多攻略只写了要满足1、2条件，但是没有写还有跟2相反的第3个条件。
最后，祝你们也都成功解锁！

author: {'steamid': '76561198335460763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1082, 'last_played': 1595004983}
review:
So i started off being like, "oh yeah, this game is aight, might recommend it to my friends who like more casual stuff." But then my daughter fucking went and squatted in a church and i instantly knew that this game was one after my own heart.

This game has realism, depth, 85 fucking endings, combat, dancing, squatting teens with cringy memes, everything you need in a good game. Some people might say this game is the game of the year, and I am one of those people because this gem is a diamond in the rough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079276033', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1677983454}
review:
Love it!
It does have a lot of charm, does not get boring, with several different endings, it is very motivating, and you feel like every little decision does actually change the outcome of your game.
Negative points: 
- I don't understand, how some of the stats influence gameplay (you need to consult a wiki to undestand some things.)
- Soundtrack is not really good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001111085', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1625765336}
review:
>decide right off the bat I wanna have a warrior daughter
>train her the entire time with kung fu and fencing
>works as a lumberjack and farmer almost 24/7
>go to arena and face the same tank every time, only weakness is magic and tanking back
>study magic a bit to face him
>random sorceror challenges daughter on the way home one day
>slice him up with my katana

author: {'steamid': '76561197999162473', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1481278289}
review:
I am not one for "visual novels" but Princess Maker 2 is a pretty amazing game. It takes the concept of a child raising simulator, a RPG, a visual novel and even in some aspects a dating sim and rolls them all into a amazing title. 

I remember playing this game back when it was on DOS and considered "abandonware", I loved the game then and I love the game now. The updated quality is great and the added features, such as audio dialog just makes the game so much better. 

I loved the fact that I was able to support a game that I had so much fun playing when I was in middle school. One can only hope the developer for the STEAM title manages to secure and translate even more Princess Maker games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027186256', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1707254020}
review:
I've spent a lot of time playing the original, and I can safely say that this is pretty much exactly the same. The only difference is the updated artwork. Personally, I would have loved an option to switch to the original sprites, since there is an option for midis.

The translation is slightly off in certain places, (no s on the end of some plurals) but it's barely noticeable.

I would have liked it if the game could have had the steam overlay and the ability to take screenshots.

Overall it's just as endearing and fun as I remember it, I'm really happy that Princess Maker 2 is on Steam.
